CustomFieldDisplay.name: CustomFieldDisplay
CustomFieldDisplay.description: Represents the view type assigned to product attribute custom fields.

DeveloperName.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Label is Record Type Name. This field is automatically generated, but you can supply your own value if you create the record using the API.

DisplayType.description: The view type of the product attribute custom fields.

FieldApiName.description: The unique name of the product attribute, for example, color_c.

ManageableState.description: Indicates the manageable state of the specified component that is contained in a package: beta deleted deprecated deprecatedEditable installed installedEditable released unmanaged

MasterLabel.description: Label for the CustomFieldDisplay. In the UI, this field is Custom Field Display.

NamespacePrefix.description: The namespace prefix associated with this object. Each Developer Edition organization that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix__componentName notation.

CustomFieldDisplay.accessRules: CustomFieldDisplay is available only if the B2B or D2C Commerce license is enabled.
